text: SoftBank fully exited its $NVDA position in Q4

I don‚Äôt think the indiscriminate selling we‚Äôre seeing in AI names right now is really about a bubble or about tech itself.

The market is clearly uncomfortable with the size of the spending cycle with $META, $AMZN, $MSFT & $GOOGL set to spend over $600B in 2026 alone and with the speed of change we‚Äôre seeing from new AI tools like Claude Cowork, Clawdbot and others that can "in theory" reshape entire industries.  

As a result, we are in a phase where the market is pricing in future uncertainty because the profit pool in the AI economy is going to look very different from the previous world. So right now, investors are stepping back from the entire AI complex and justifying that caution with whichever negative narrative feels most emotionally convincing in the moment.

That behavior is understandable during periods of uncertainty but it also creates MASSIVE opportunity in companies with real moats in the new economy being built in real time, especially when stocks are being priced as if multiple worst-case outcomes are all going to happen at the same time.

üì∫ IS THE MEMORY GROUP STILL ‚ÄúSPECIAL‚Äù?

$MU, $SNDK, and $WDC were some of the strongest names in the market recently.

The key question is whether this group can maintain its leadership while broader tech faces downside pressure.

$MU trade framework:
‚Äì If $MU holds $386‚Äì$392, you stay long. 
‚Äì If it breaks $386, it‚Äôs no longer showing strength and likely needs to be exited. 
‚Äì If the market dips early but $MU doesn‚Äôt go down, that‚Äôs relative strength and could offer a buy for a move back to green.
‚Äì If the market bounces and $MU doesn‚Äôt respond, that‚Äôs a warning sign‚Äîit may be catching down instead of leading up.

I cover the same trade framework for $SNDK in this short video.

Keep $MU, $SNDK, and $WDC up together. If the group moves together and shows resilience, it‚Äôs a theme worth staying with. If one starts cracking, the odds increase that the rest will follow.

üì∫ THIS MARKET NEEDS RESOLUTION

The market is stuck in a range. Breakouts fail, breakdowns bounce, and both longs and shorts get frustrated.

We need a decisive move that breaks the range and sticks.

That could mean:
üîª A clean break below support $QQQ $596 / $SPY $675 and follow-through toward the 200-day
üî∫ A strong reclaim of resistance $QQQ $606+ that brings momentum back

Right now, this is not a trending, easy environment. It‚Äôs more tactical. The next clean move will come from whether support holds or fails.
